etymology.description: 停(停) (tíng, "stop"), 車(車) (chē, "vehicle"), 場(場) (chǎng, "field; place")
etymology.interpretation: The word 停車場 (tíngchēchǎng) combines 停(停) (tíng, "stop"), 車(車) (chē, "vehicle"), and 場(場) (chǎng, "field; place") to refer to a designated area where vehicles are stopped and parked. This combination makes sense because it specifies a place specifically meant for the cessation and storage of vehicles.

examples.chinese: 停车场很大(停車場很大)。
examples.english: The parking lot is very large.

examples.chinese: 我去停车场(我去停車場)，寻找一个空位(尋找一個空位)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ qù tíngchēchǎng, xúnzhǎo yīgè kòngwèi.
examples.english: I go to the parking lot to look for an empty spot.

examples.chinese: 早晨上班时(早晨上班時)，停车场已经满了(停車場已經滿了)。
examples.pinyin: Zǎochén shàngbān shí, tíngchēchǎng yǐjīng mǎnle.
examples.english: During the morning rush, the parking lot is already full.
